revised_title: Observations of the Transit of Mercury in 1782
tldr: The author, James Augustus Hamilton, describes his observations of the 1782 transit of Mercury over the Sun from Cook's Town, Ireland. He used a transit instrument and a clock to record the event, noting the precise time of ingress and egress. Hamilton also discusses his equipment, including an achromatic telescope and a stop watch, and shares his estimated location based on previous observations.
